title: PAIC Econometrics Research
text:
Integrating Time Series Forecasting, Multi-Objective Decision Making & Reinforcement Learning
An innovative research initiative at FAE Business School developing patent-ready methodologies for agricultural commodities portfolio optimization through advanced econometric and machine learning techniques.

Explore Our Research → View Publications →

title: PAIC Econometrics Research
text:
🎯 Research Vision
This Scientific Initiation Project (PAIC - Programa de Apoio à Iniciação Científica) represents the continuation and evolution of pioneering work initiated at PUCPR, now advancing at FAE Business School with enhanced scope and objectives.

🎓 Academic Goals
Primary Objectives:

Patent Development: Create innovative methodologies for multi-period portfolio optimization
Scientific Publications: Contribute to academic literature on agricultural finance
Doctoral Research Integration: Support ongoing PhD thesis development
Undergraduate Excellence: Train students in cutting-edge quantitative finance

Institutional Context:
This project builds upon the foundation established at PUCPR (visit the previous project site) while expanding into new frontiers of agricultural commodity portfolio management.

title: PAIC Econometrics Research
text:
🔬 Core Research Framework
Our methodology integrates three fundamental pillars:


📈 Time Series Forecasting
Advanced predictive modeling for commodity prices using:

ARIMA/GARCH family models
Bayesian structural time series
LSTM and GRU neural networks
Ensemble forecasting methods
Hawkes processes for news impact

Econometrics Deep Learning Bayesian Methods


🎯 Multi-Objective Optimization
Portfolio optimization considering multiple conflicting objectives:

Return maximization
Risk minimization
Liquidity management
Sustainability criteria
Dynamic rebalancing strategies

Evolutionary Algorithms Pareto Optimization Fuzzy Logic


🤖 Reinforcement Learning
Adaptive decision-making strategies:

Q-Learning for portfolio selection
Deep Q-Networks (DQN)
Policy gradient methods
Multi-agent systems
Dynamic strategy adaptation

RL Algorithms Adaptive Systems Decision Theory

title: PAIC Econometrics Research
text:
📊 Key Commodities Focus
Our research concentrates on Brazilian agricultural grain commodities:

title: PAIC Econometrics Research
text:
🛠️ Technical Stack

Development Environment
Programming & Analysis:

R Ecosystem: tidyverse, forecast, rugarch, quantmod, PerformanceAnalytics
Python Ecosystem: pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, tensorflow, pytorch, stable-baselines3
Integration: Quarto for reproducible research combining R and Python

Data Sources:

Bloomberg Terminal
B3 (Brasil, Bolsa, Balcão)
CEPEA/ESALQ price indices
USDA agricultural reports
News APIs for sentiment analysis

Infrastructure:

Version control: Git/GitHub
Collaboration: RStudio/Positron IDE
Deployment: GitHub Pages
Documentation: Quarto publishing system

title: PAIC Econometrics Research
text:
📈 Research Methodology Workflow





flowchart TD
    A[Data Collection] --> B[Data Preprocessing]
    B --> C[Exploratory Analysis]
    C --> D[Feature Engineering]
    D --> E[Model Development]
    E --> F{Model Type}
    F -->|Time Series| G[ARIMA/GARCH/LSTM]
    F -->|Optimization| H[Multi-Objective Algorithms]
    F -->|RL| I[Agent Training]
    G --> J[Model Validation]
    H --> J
    I --> J
    J --> K[Backtesting]
    K --> L[Performance Evaluation]
    L --> M{Satisfactory?}
    M -->|No| E
    M -->|Yes| N[Documentation & Publication]
    N --> O[Patent Application]
    
    style A fill:#003d7a,color:#fff
    style N fill:#28a745,color:#fff
    style O fill:#ff6b35,color:#fff

title: About the Project
text:
Advancing Agricultural Finance Through Innovation
A multidisciplinary team combining expertise in Economics, Data Science, and Quantitative Finance to develop cutting-edge solutions for commodity portfolio management.

title: About the Project
text:
🎯 Project Mission

Our Purpose
This Scientific Initiation Project (PAIC - Programa de Apoio à Iniciação Científica) at FAE Business School represents a strategic evolution of research initiated at PUCPR, now with enhanced objectives:
Core Mission:

Develop patentable methodologies for multi-period commodity portfolio optimization
Publish high-impact scientific research in agricultural finance
Support doctoral research on multi-objective optimization
Train undergraduate students in advanced quantitative methods
Bridge the gap between academic research and industry applications

Research Philosophy:
We believe in combining rigorous econometric theory with practical machine learning applications, creating solutions that are both academically sound and industrially relevant.

title: About the Project
text:
👥 Meet the Team




Prof. Rodrigo Hermont Ozon
Principal Investigator & Research Advisor
Economist (UFPR, 2008) and MSc in Economic Development (UFPR, 2010), currently pursuing a PhD in Production and Systems Engineering (PPGEPS/PUCPR, 2022-2026). His doctoral thesis focuses on multi-objective multi-period optimization of agricultural commodity portfolios using time series forecasting, multi-criteria decision-making, and reinforcement learning.
Research Expertise:

Econometric modeling and time series analysis
Multi-objective optimization algorithms
Agricultural commodity markets
Quantitative finance and risk management
Integration of R and Python for financial modeling

Academic Background:

15+ years of experience in econometric research
Published research in agricultural economics and quantitative methods
Extensive experience with Quarto, R, and Python ecosystems
Industry consulting in commodity markets

Time Series Forecasting Multi-Objective Optimization R & Python Agricultural Finance
Contact:

Research Focus:

Machine learning model development

Neural network architectures (LSTM, GRU)
Feature engineering for time series
Model validation and backtesting

Project Contributions:

Development of predictive ML models for commodity prices
Implementation of ensemble forecasting techniques
Python-based data pipeline automation
Model performance benchmarking

Python Machine Learning Deep Learning Time Series
Areas of Interest: Quantitative trading, algorithmic finance, artificial intelligence

title: About the Project
text:
🎓 Academic Context

FAE Business School

Founded in 1957, FAE Centro Universitário is one of Brazil’s most prestigious business schools, located in Curitiba, Paraná. FAE is recognized for:

Excellence in business and economics education
Strong industry partnerships
Commitment to scientific research
Modern facilities and technology infrastructure
Strategic location in one of Brazil’s economic hubs

PAIC Program:
The PAIC (Programa de Apoio à Iniciação Científica) is FAE’s scientific initiation program that supports undergraduate research projects, fostering academic excellence and preparing students for graduate studies and professional careers in research.



Project Lineage






🔗 Connection to Previous Research



This project builds upon and extends research initiated at PUCPR (Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Paraná) under the PIBIC and PIBITI Jr. programs.
Previous Project:
PIBIC AgroFinance - PUCPR
The FAE project expands the scope with: - Enhanced multi-objective optimization framework - Integration of reinforcement learning strategies - Focus on patent-ready methodologies - Expanded team with diverse expertise - Broader publication strategy

title: About the Project
text:
🔬 Research Methodology
Our interdisciplinary approach combines:

📊 Econometric Foundations

Classical time series analysis (ARIMA, VAR)
Volatility modeling (GARCH family)
Bayesian econometrics
Cointegration and causality testing



🤖 Machine Learning Integration

Supervised learning for prediction
Deep learning for complex patterns
Ensemble methods for robustness
Feature importance analysis



🎯 Optimization Techniques

Multi-objective evolutionary algorithms
Pareto frontier exploration
Fuzzy multi-criteria decision making
Dynamic programming approaches



🧠 Reinforcement Learning

Q-Learning and DQN for portfolio selection
Policy gradient methods
Multi-agent systems
Adaptive strategy development

title: About the Project
text:
🛠️ Technical Infrastructure

Tools & Technologies
Development Environment:

IDEs: RStudio, Positron, VS Code, Jupyter
Languages: R (primary), Python (secondary), SQL
Documentation: Quarto publishing system
Version Control: Git/GitHub
Deployment: GitHub Pages

Key R Packages:
tidyverse • forecast • rugarch • quantmod • PerformanceAnalytics • portfolioAnalytics • DEoptim • mco • bayesforecast
Key Python Libraries:
pandas • numpy • scikit-learn • tensorflow • pytorch • stable-baselines3 • gym • plotly • streamlit
Data Sources:

Bloomberg Terminal
B3 (Brasil, Bolsa, Balcão)
CEPEA/ESALQ commodity indices
USDA agricultural reports
News APIs (for sentiment analysis)

title: About the Project
text:
🎯 Expected Outcomes

Academic Deliverables
Partial Report 1 (November 24, 2025)

Curated datasets and data infrastructure
Initial GARCH/MSGARCH volatility models
Preliminary ML/DL forecasting results
Validation metrics and benchmarks

Partial Report 2 (March 2026)

Complete Pareto frontier analysis
Multi-objective optimization results
RL agent implementation and training
Comprehensive backtesting results

Qualification Seminar (March-April 2026)

Project methodology presentation
Preliminary findings discussion
Peer feedback integration
Refinement of research direction

Scientific Article (July 6, 2026)

Full methodology documentation
Comprehensive results and analysis
Reproducible code repository
Submission to peer-reviewed journal

Conference Presentations

13th SPPAIC Symposium (October 24-25, 2025): Project proposal and initial results
14th SPPAIC Symposium (August 10, 2026): Final results and poster presentation



Technical Deliverables

Reproducible Research Repository

Complete R/Python codebase
Documentation and tutorials
Jupyter/Quarto notebooks
Data processing pipelines

Educational Materials

Tutorial notebooks for students
Best practices documentation
Replication guides
Open-source contributions

Practical Applications

Portfolio optimization framework
Risk management dashboards
Trading strategy backtests
Industry-ready tools




Student Development

Advanced technical skills in R and Python
Experience with scientific research methodology
Portfolio of demonstrable projects
Publication track record
Professional networking opportunities
